archetypes.name: Family Weeknight Classics (SA & US)
archetypes.description: Kid-friendly, crowd-pleasing dinners with familiar South African and American flavors, built for quick weeknights.
archetypes.rationale: Establishes a mainstream, high-appeal family weeknight baseline (simple, 15–30 min, mild heat) across South African and American comfort cuisines to anchor broad coverage early.

archetypes.name: Family Middle Eastern & Greek Mezze Nights
archetypes.description: Build-it-yourself family dinners with shawarma-style meats or veggie trays, herby rice, and simple dips for mix-and-match plates.
archetypes.rationale: Complements the existing SA/US weeknight mild set by offering a medium-heat, from-scratch family option in Middle Eastern/Greek flavors with a longer 30–60 minute window and intermediate assembly-style workflow.

archetypes.name: Family Set-and-Forget Slow Cooker (Mexican & Latin American)
archetypes.description: Hands-off slow cooker family dinners with Mexican and broader Latin American flavors—taco-ready shredded meats/beans, stews, and rice-friendly dishes that cook low and slow while you get on with your day.
archetypes.rationale: This fills the uncovered family-friendly, hands-off 60+ minute Simple slot with kid-approachable Mild heat and non-overlapping Mexican/Latin American flavors for easy weeknight batch cooking.

archetypes.name: Family 15‑Minute Stir‑Fry & Noodle Nights (Chinese/Japanese/Korean)
archetypes.description: Speedy, kid‑friendly stove‑top stir‑fries and noodle bowls with Chinese, Japanese, and Korean flavors using bagged veg, quick sauces, and tender proteins for weeknight dinners.
archetypes.rationale: Fills the Under15, Simple, NoHeat/Mild family gap with East Asian flavors not yet covered by existing South African/American, Middle Eastern/Greek, or Mexican/Latin slow‑cooker sets.

archetypes.name: Family Indian Curry & Biryani Nights
archetypes.description: Family-sized Indian dinners featuring gentle curries, dal, tandoori-style oven roasts, and occasional one-pot biryani with rice or flatbread sides.
archetypes.rationale: Adds an Indian family-friendly lane with adjustable mild-to-medium heat and 30–60 minute from-scratch meals, complementing existing SA/US, Middle Eastern/Greek, Mexican/Latin slow-cooker, and East Asian quick stir-fry coverage without overlap.

archetypes.name: Family Mediterranean Oven Bakes (Italian/Spanish/Portuguese)
archetypes.description: Hands-off, family-sized oven bakes and sheet-pan dinners with Italian, Spanish, and Portuguese flavors—think pasta bakes, roasted chicken-and-potato trays, and veggie-forward casseroles for crowd-pleasing weeknights.
archetypes.rationale: Adds a mainstream, kid-friendly Mediterranean oven-bake format not covered by existing archetypes, expanding European cuisine variety with simple, hands-off family dinners.

archetypes.name: Family Thai & Vietnamese Quick Bowls
archetypes.description: 15–30 minute family dinners with Thai and Vietnamese flavors—stir-fried rice noodles, lemongrass meats or tofu, herby rice bowls, and speedy pho‑style soups with kid‑adjustable toppings.
archetypes.rationale: Adds a mainstream family weeknight option covering Southeast Asian (Thai/Vietnamese) flavors with mild-to-medium heat and quick, simple builds not yet represented by existing folders.

archetypes.name: Family AirFryer Weeknight Wins
archetypes.description: Ultra-fast, kid-friendly family dinners centered on the air fryer—crispy mains and veg sides with minimal prep for busy weeknights.
archetypes.rationale: Adds a high-demand, not-yet-covered family archetype focused on AirFryer speed and kid-safe heat levels for weeknight convenience.

archetypes.name: Family Caribbean Grill Nights (Jerk & BBQ)
archetypes.description: Spicy, flavor-packed family dinners centered on jerk-style grills and Caribbean BBQ—marinated chicken, pork, or tofu with rice and peas, slaw, and grilled veg.
archetypes.rationale: Adds a Hot-leaning, OutdoorGrill-focused Caribbean option for families—filling gaps in cuisine, heat, and equipment not covered by existing weeknight and oven/slow-cooker archetypes.

archetypes.name: Family North African Tagine & Couscous Nights
archetypes.description: Family-sized Moroccan/Algerian/Tunisian-inspired dinners—tagines, chermoula-roasted fish or veg, and couscous/bean sides—with balanced, kid-manageable warmth and approachable steps.
archetypes.rationale: Adds missing North African family coverage with 30–60 minute, mild-to-medium meals that complement existing Mediterranean/Middle Eastern sets without overlap.
